1.text: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brothers, I would not have you ignorant.

2.text: You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these dumb idols, even as you were led.

3.text: Why I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed: and that no man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Ghost.

4.text: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

5.text: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

6.text: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God which works all in all.

7.text: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit with.

8.text: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;

9.text: To another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

10.text: To another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to another divers kinds of tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:

11.text: But all these works that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

12.text: For as the body is one, and has many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also is Christ.

13.text: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether we be Jews or Gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

14.text: For the body is not one member, but many.

15.text: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

16.text: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

17.text: If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?

18.text: But now has God set the members every one of them in the body, as it has pleased him.

19.text: And if they were all one member, where were the body?

20.text: But now are they many members, yet but one body.

21.text: And the eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of you: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

22.text: No, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:

23.text: And those members of the body, which we think to be less honorable, on these we bestow more abundant honor; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness.

24.text: For our comely parts have no need: but God has tempered the body together, having given more abundant honor to that part which lacked.

25.text: That there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.

26.text: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honored, all the members rejoice with it.

27.text: Now you are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

28.text: And God has set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.

29.text: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all workers of miracles?

30.text: Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?

31.text: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet show I to you a more excellent way.
